content.content: Hi everyone, I’ve thoroughly studied The MakerDao protocol recently, and one thing I still struggle to understand is how a vote is implemented, once voted. For example, if we raise to the developers is agreed upon, how can we make sure it is effective ? Similarly, if the development of a code takes longer than expected, what happens ? Or if the peg value is wrongly modified, how can we know/act upon it ? Thank you very much !
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is seeking feedback and asking questions about the implementation of governance votes in the MakerDao protocol. They are specifically asking about how to ensure the effectiveness of a vote, what happens if development takes longer than expected, and how to know and act upon wrongly modified peg values.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: There is a guide for this here:   makerdao.world   How Voting Works How voting works in the Maker Protocol.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
